M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..title: Selection.PickObject(ObjectType) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..desc: Prompts the user to select one object.
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..remarks: Revit users will be permitted to manipulate the Revit view (zooming, panning, and rotating the view), but will not be permitted to click other items in the Revit user interface. Users are not permitted to switch the active view, close the active document or Revit application in the pick session, otherwise an exception will be thrown.The selection will not be automatically added to the active selection buffer.Note: this method must not be called during dynamic update, otherwise ForbiddenForDynamicUpdateException will be thrown.

M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..title: Selection.PickBox(PickBoxStyle) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..desc: Invokes a general purpose two-click editor that lets the user to specify a rectangular area on the screen.
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..remarks: The method starts an editor and returns when it finishes. Returns a PickedBox that contains two XYZ points.

M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..title: Selection.PickObjects(ObjectType, ISelectionFilter, String) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..desc: Prompts the user to select multiple objects which pass a custom filter while showing a custom status prompt string.
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..remarks: The user will be shown "Finish" and "Cancel" buttons on the dialog bar to complete the selection operation. Uncheck the "Multiple" check-box to select single object and it will return the selected object directly.Revit users will be permitted to manipulate the Revit view (zooming, panning, and rotating the view), but will not be permitted to click other items in the Revit user interface. Users are not permitted to switch the active view, close the active document or Revit application in the pick session, otherwise an exception will be thrown.The selection will not be automatically added to the active selection buffer.Note: this method must not be called during dynamic update, otherwise ForbiddenForDynamicUpdateException will be thrown.

M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..title: Selection.PickElementsByRectangle Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..desc: Prompts the user to select multiple elements by drawing a rectangle.
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..remarks: Revit users will be permitted to manipulate the Revit view (zooming, panning, and rotating the view), but will not be permitted to click other items in the Revit user interface. Users are not permitted to switch the active view, close the active document or Revit application in the pick session, otherwise an exception will be thrown.The selection will not be automatically added to the active selection buffer.Note: this method must not be called during dynamic update, otherwise ForbiddenForDynamicUpdateException will be thrown.

T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection.title: Selection Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection.desc: Contains the current user selection of elements within the project.
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection.remarks: The Selection object is used to retrieve the current user selected elements when an external API command is executed.

M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selection..remarks: The references can be an element or subelement in the host or a linked document.

T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selectable.title: SelectableInViewFilter Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selectable.desc: A filter that passes elements that are selectable in the given view.
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.Selectable.remarks: This filter is a slow filter. Slow filters require that the Element be obtained and expanded in memory first. Thus it is preferable to couple this filter with at least one ElementQuickFilter, which should minimize the number of Elements that are expanded. This filter is designed to operate on a list of elements visible in the given view. This can be obtained from a FilteredElementCollector constructed with the view id. This filter may not correctly restrict elements which are not a part of the visible elements of the view.

props.d:
True if the results of the filter are inverted; elements that would normally be accepted by this filter will be rejected,
   and elements that would normally be rejected will be accepted.
(Inherited from ElementFilter)

M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.ISelection.title: ISelectionFilter.AllowElement Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.ISelection.desc: Override this pre-filter method to specify if the element should be permitted to be selected.
M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Selection.ISelection.remarks: If prompting the user to select an element from a Revit Link instance, the element passed here will be the link instance, not the selected linked element. Access the linked element from Reference passed to the AllowReference() callback of ISelectionFilter.If an exception is thrown from this method, the element will not be permitted to be selected.
